page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO THE BLOCK
page.content: This block is within the Tyne and Wear conurbtion:a typical urban area based on long established industries which are now in decline. The R.Tyne flows through this block which is about eight kilometres from the coast. The land is gently sloping although the immediate sides of the rivers are steep. The economic growth of the area was a result of the development of the Northumberland and Durham. Coalfield and the rivers as a means of transport and trade. The block is with in the N.E. regancy of England. This region has traditonaly had a very strong local identity via dialect, customs, jobs and social and economic problems.
